GenerativeAIinEUlaw: Liability, privacy, intellectual property, and cybersecurity

The complexity and emergent autonomy of Generative AI systems introduce challenges in predictability and legal compliance. This paper analyses some of the legal and regulatory implications of such challenges in the European Union context, focusing on four areas: liability, privacy, intellectual property, and cybersecurity.

Key Concepts:

  • The complexity and emergent autonomy of Generative AI systems introduce challenges in predictability and legal compliance.
  • Potential gaps and shortcomings in the EU legislative framework.
  • The need for safe and compliant deployment of generative models.
GenerativeAI EUlaw Liability Privacy Intellectualproperty Cybersecurity
Research Intermediate
